body:
Chicago Equity Partners Llc decreased its stake in Apple Inc (AAPL) by 8.88% based on its latest 2016Q3 regulatory filing with the SEC. Chicago Equity Partners Llc sold 82,925 shares as the company’s stock rose 17.90% with the market. The institutional investor held 850,674 shares of the computer manufacturing company at the end of 2016Q3, valued at $96.17M, down from 933,599 at the end of the previous reported quarter. Chicago Equity Partners Llc who had been investing in Apple Inc for a number of months, seems to be less bullish one the $640.03B market cap company. The stock decreased 0.18% or $0.22 during the last trading session, hitting $121.72. About 8,298 shares traded hands. Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) has risen 26.90% since June 23, 2016 and is uptrending. It has outperformed by 18.32% the S&P500.

Chicago Equity Partners Llc, which manages about $10.49 billion and $3.62 billion US Long portfolio, upped its stake in Senior Hsg Pptys Tr (NYSE:SNH) by 256,905 shares to 306,595 shares, valued at $6.96 million in 2016Q3, according to the filing. It also increased its holding in Wal (NYSE:WMT) by 134,930 shares in the quarter, for a total of 454,690 shares, and has risen its stake in Merck & Co Inc (NYSE:MRK).

Insitutional Activity: The institutional sentiment decreased to 0.82 in Q3 2016. Its down 0.07, from 0.89 in 2016Q2. The ratio fall, as 68 funds sold all AAPL shares owned while 1000 reduced positions. 172 funds bought stakes while 704 increased positions. They now own 2.98 billion shares or 1.16% more from 2.95 billion shares in 2016Q2. Fayerweather Charles holds 19,551 shares or 3.1% of its portfolio. New Jersey Better Educational Savings holds 3.28% of its portfolio in Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) for 45,000 shares. Welch Grp Inc Limited Liability last reported 15,629 shares in the company. First Quadrant LP Ca reported 932,131 shares or 2.23% of all its holdings. Moreover, Baskin Fin Inc has 5.12% invested in Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) for 173,101 shares. Equitec Proprietary Mkts Limited last reported 500 shares in the company. Rafferty Asset Mngmt Lc has 6,389 shares for 0.03% of their US portfolio. Advisory Services Ntwk Ltd Liability Corporation owns 83,070 shares or 1.77% of their US portfolio. Moreover, Van Cleef Asset Managementinc has 6.49% invested in Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) for 172,796 shares. Park National Oh holds 1.88% or 261,533 shares in its portfolio. Town And Country Retail Bank And Tru Dba First Bankers Tru has 1.39% invested in the company for 21,861 shares. Bryn Mawr last reported 2.16% of its portfolio in the stock. Mountain Pacific Invest Advisers Incorporated Id reported 6,669 shares or 0.08% of all its holdings. Natixis owns 4.13M shares or 5.4% of their US portfolio. Parthenon Limited Liability Com owns 24,041 shares or 0.67% of their US portfolio.

Insider Transactions: Since August 2, 2016, the stock had 0 insider buys, and 25 insider sales for $169.69 million net activity. Maestri Luca had sold 2,300 shares worth $270,652 on Tuesday, December 27. KONDO CHRIS had sold 9,829 shares worth $1.03M. Another trade for 30,000 shares valued at $3.64 million was made by COOK TIMOTHY D on Wednesday, January 25. LEVINSON ARTHUR D sold $7.61M worth of stock. Riccio Daniel J. also sold $5.30 million worth of Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) shares. Srouji Johny had sold 9,827 shares worth $1.07M. Shares for $2.51M were sold by SEWELL D BRUCE.

More notable recent Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) news were published by: Forbes.com which released: “Earnings Preview: What To Expect From Apple On Tuesday” on January 29, 2017, also Finance.Yahoo.com with their article: “Earnings Alert: The Astonishing Truth Behind Apple” published on January 29, 2017, Nasdaq.com published: “Will Lawsuits Force Apple, Inc. To Prevent Texting And Driving?” on January 29, 2017. More interesting news about Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) were released by: Fool.com and their article: “Apple, Inc. Brings Its Fight With Qualcomm to China” published on January 25, 2017 as well as Fool.com‘s news article titled: “Earnings Preview: Can Apple, Inc. Return to Growth?” with publication date: January 24, 2017.

According to Zacks Investment Research, “Apple Inc. is engaged in designing, manufacturing and marketing mobile communication and media devices, personal computers, and portable digital music players. The Company’s products and services include iPhone, iPad, Mac, iPod, Apple TV, a portfolio of consumer and professional software applications, the iOS and Mac OS X operating systems, iCloud, and a range of accessory, service and support offerings. It sells its products worldwide through its online stores, its retail stores, its direct sales force, third-party wholesalers, and resellers. Apple Inc. is headquartered in Cupertino, California.”

Out of 44 analysts covering Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL), 37 rate it a “Buy”, 1 “Sell”, while 6 “Hold”. This means 84% are positive. $200 is the highest target while $11 is the lowest. The $129.20 average target is 6.15% above today’s ($121.72) stock price. Apple Inc. has been the topic of 194 analyst reports since July 21, 2015 according to StockzIntelligence Inc. The rating was maintained by RBC Capital Markets on Wednesday, July 27 with “Outperform”. Oppenheimer maintained it with “Outperform” rating and $155 target price in Tuesday, August 11 report. Susquehanna maintained it with “Buy” rating and $155 target price in Friday, September 11 report. The firm earned “Overweight” rating on Thursday, October 13 by Pacific Crest. The stock of Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) has “Overweight” rating given on Thursday, September 29 by Barclays Capital. Argus Research maintained Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) on Wednesday, January 27 with “Buy” rating. The stock of Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) has “Overweight” rating given on Wednesday, October 26 by Morgan Stanley. The company was maintained on Thursday, August 11 by RBC Capital Markets. On Monday, October 26 the stock rating was maintained by FBR Capital with “Outperform.”. As per Wednesday, April 20, the company rating was maintained by Barclays Capital.

Apple Inc., incorporated on January 3, 1977, designs, makes and markets mobile communication and media devices, personal computers and portable digital music players. The Firm sells a range of related software, services, accessories, networking solutions and third-party digital content and applications. The Company’s divisions include the Americas, Europe, Greater China, Japan and Rest of Asia Pacific. The Americas segment includes both North and South America. The Europe segment includes European countries, India, the Middle East and Africa. The Greater China segment includes China, Hong Kong and Taiwan. The Rest of Asia Pacific segment includes Australia and the Asian countries not included in the Company’s other operating divisions. The Company’s services and products include iPhone, iPad, Mac, iPod, Apple Watch, Apple TV, a portfolio of consumer and professional software applications, iPhone OS (iOS), OS X and watchOS operating systems, iCloud, Apple Pay and a range of accessory, service and support offerings.
title: Chicago Equity Partners LLC Position in Apple INC (AAPL) Cut by $9.37 Million
